Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Trickery \Trick"er*y\, n. The art of dressing up; artifice; stratagem; fraud; imposture. [1913 Webster]

trickery n 1: verbal misrepresentation intended to take advantage of you in some way [syn: {hocus-pocus}, {slickness}, {hanky panky}, {jiggery-pokery}, {skulduggery}, {skullduggery}] 2: the use of tricks to deceive someone (usually to extract money from them) [syn: {chicanery}, {chicane}, {guile}, {wile}, {shenanigan}]
